description:
The In Situ TAC is a distributed centre organized around 7 oceanographic
regions: the global ocean and the 6 EUROGOOS regional alliances. It involves
14 partners from 11 countries in Europe. It doesn't deploy any observing
system and relies on data, exclusively funded by other sources than
Copernicus Marine Service.

This dataset contains sea surface current observations from High-Frequency
(HF) radars. Sea surface currents measured by HF radar are an average over
the top 0.3-2.5 m of the water column, depending on the operating central
frequency.

This dataset provides total velocity components. It comprises gridded maps
of total velocity fields of the surface current averaged over a time
interval. Total velocities are derived using an un-weighted least-square fit
that maps radial velocities, measured by individual measurement stations,
onto a Cartesian grid. The final product is a map of the zonal and
meridional components of the ocean currents on a regular grid in the area of
overlap of two or more radar stations.

For more details refer to this
[user manual](https://documentation.marine.copernicus.eu/PUM/CMEMS-INS-PUM-013-048.pdf)

links.title: Run the example for COPERNICUS/MARINE/INSITU_MULTI_4KM/RADAR_TOTAL in the Earth Engine Code Editor

gee:terms_of_use:
The data is provided free of charge by the Copernicus Marine Service.
Users must acknowledge the Copernicus Marine Service as the data source
when using the data. More details on the terms of use can be found on
the [Copernicus Marine Service website](https://marine.copernicus.eu/user-corner/service-commitments-and-licence).
title: Copernicus Global In-situ Observations of Ocean Currents - Radar Total

gee:schema.description: Datetime of the observation
gee:schema.name: TIME

gee:schema.description: Latitude of the observation
gee:schema.name: LATITUDE

gee:schema.description: Longitude of the observation
gee:schema.name: LONGITUDE

gee:schema.description: Number of depth levels
gee:schema.name: DEPTH

gee:schema.description: Depth of the observation (m)
gee:schema.name: DEPH

gee:schema.description: Geometric Dilution of Precision
gee:schema.name: GDOP

gee:schema.description:
Quality control flag for DDNS.

* 0: No QC was performed
* 1: good
* 2: probably good
* 3: Bad data that are potentially correctable
* 4: Bad data
* 5: value changed
* 6: Not used
* 7: nominal
* 8: interpolated
* 9: Missing value

Note that a valid value for the corresponding variable has a QC bit
equal to 1, 2, 5, 7, or 8.
gee:schema.name: DDNS_QC

gee:schema.description:
Quality control flag for CSPD.

* 0: No QC was performed
* 1: good
* 2: probably good
* 3: Bad data that are potentially correctable
* 4: Bad data
* 5: value changed
* 6: Not used
* 7: nominal
* 8: interpolated
* 9: Missing value

Note that a valid value for the corresponding variable has a QC bit
equal to 1, 2, 5, 7, or 8.
gee:schema.name: CSPD_QC

gee:schema.description:
Quality control flag for VART.

* 0: No QC was performed
* 1: good
* 2: probably good
* 3: Bad data that are potentially correctable
* 4: Bad data
* 5: value changed

gee:schema.description:

* 0: No QC was performed
* 1: good
* 2: probably good
* 3: Bad data that are potentially correctable
* 4: Bad data

gee:schema.description:
Overall quality flag

Note: a value of 1 here indicates that all data in that row's source
file was good, but because each row has QC bits for individual fields,
a value other than 1 here does not necessarily mean that a row cannot
or should not be used.
gee:schema.name: QCflag

gee:schema.description: Surface Eastward sea water velocity (m/s)
gee:schema.name: EWCT

gee:schema.description: Surface Northward sea water velocity (m/s)
gee:schema.name: NSCT

gee:schema.description: Standard Deviation Of Surface Eastward Sea Water Velocity (m/s)
gee:schema.name: EWCS

gee:schema.description: Standard Deviation Of Surface Northward Sea Water Velocity (m/s)
gee:schema.name: NSCS

gee:schema.description: Covariance of Surface Sea Water Velocity (m^2/s^2)
gee:schema.name: CCOV
